p: The second largest subtype B cluster contained 1492 sequences including 2 NCC sequences and 1490 LANL sequences, 1471 of which were from Japan. This cluster contained sequences closely related to the previously reported JP.MSM.B-1 strain, which accounts for one third of infections in Japanese MSM [ 27] ( Supplementary Figure 3). One of the 2 NCC sequences was found within a well supported subclade originating in 1995 (approximate high posterior density [HPD] interval: 1992â€“1998) ( Supplementary Figure 4). This subclade contained 4 European and 4 Asian sequences described by Takebe et al [ 27] as evidence of global dissemination of the B-1 strain.
